titleStmt.title: Loves mistery: or, A parcel of clouded waggery. 'Tis all mens fancy to commend, that which is smooth and witty; more pleasant lines were never penn'd, they are so wondrous pretty. Tune is, She lay naked in her bed, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Kenrick at the Black-spread Eagle in the Old Baily,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "All in the merry month of May,".
In two parts, printed side by side.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Black-spread Eagle in the Old Baily
